conbody.p: XML data formatoverviewWhen writing XML data, destinations create a valid XML document for each record. The destination requires the record to have a single root field that contains the rest of the record data.

When writing XML data, you can configure the destination to perform the following tasks:
Produce a "pretty" output - The destination can add indentation to make the XML data human-readable. This adds additional bytes to the record size.
Validate the schema - The destination can validate
